name: Introduction to Chemistry I
description: This course covers the fundamentals of chemistry, including atomic structure, chemical bonding, stoichiometry, states of matter, thermochemistry, and properties of solutions.

name: Introduction to Chemistry II
description: This course builds on the concepts introduced in Introduction to Chemistry I and further explores chemical reactions, kinetics, acid-base chemistry, and thermodynamics.

name: Organic Chemistry I
description: This course provides an introduction to organic chemistry and covers topics such as structure, bonding, stereochemistry, acid-base reactions, and substitution reactions.

name: Organic Chemistry II
description: This course is a continuation of Organic Chemistry I and covers topics such as elimination reactions, spectroscopy, and reaction mechanisms.

name: Inorganic Chemistry I
description: This course introduces the fundamentals of inorganic chemistry and covers topics such as atomic structure, chemical bonding, coordination compounds, and acid-base chemistry.

name: Inorganic Chemistry II
description: This course is a continuation of Inorganic Chemistry I and covers topics such as thermodynamics, kinetics, and electrochemistry.

name: Materials Chemistry
description: This course introduces the study of materials chemistry and covers topics such as structure, properties, and synthesis of materials.
